page.title: 01RIVER MEESE VALLEY
page.content: Mainly an area of agricultural land on glacial drift soils producing sugar beet, potatoes, barley, wheat. Central section is drained by R. Meese with several original working mills - cereals and paper - now converted to residential use apart from A41T road in N.E. sector area is accessible only by narrow lanes and farm trucks. Much of the land to the east was part of the Chetwynd Estate - now mainly sold off. The farming scene is still dominated by several large units particularly to north and south of the block. Main occupation is still farming, although hamlets show a mixture of original cottages, larger coverted and modernised "country properties" and scattered more modern individual houses. To the east of a large block of coniferous woodland - some 20-30 years old which is managed
